issue.title: Fixed rare race condition error when creating the basetemp directory

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Fix #5524

Probably hard/impossible to reproduce in a test, I'm afraid.

rename.to: Race condition error while creating basetemp concurrently

body: As discussed in #5525, will investigate this further.

Got the same error again, but this time in a project which doesn't really do anything special about the `basetemp` other than passing it on the command line:

```
$ pytest -ra -l --junitxml=build/tests/pytests.xml --cov=source/python --cov-report=xml:build/tests/coverage.xml --color=yes --basetemp="W:/workspace/eden-master-win64/tmp" -n auto source/python
```

Here's the full output:

```
10:14:27 ================================================= test session starts =================================================
10:14:27 platform win32 -- Python 3.6.7, pytest-4.5.0, py-1.7.0, pluggy-0.11.0
10:14:27 rootdir: K:\eden, inifile: pytest.ini
10:14:27 plugins: xdist-1.26.1, timeout-1.3.3, replay-0.2.2, regressions-1.0.5, mock-1.10.0, localserver-0.5.0, lazy-fixture-0.5.1, forked-1.0.2, datadir-1.3.0, cpp-1.1.0, cov-2.6.1
10:14:27 gw0 I / gw1 I / gw2 I / gw3 I / gw4 I / gw5 I
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR> Traceback (most recent call last):
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\_pytest\main.py", line 203, in wrap_session
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     config.hook.pytest_sessionstart(session=session)
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\pluggy\hooks.py", line 289, in __call__
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     return self._hookexec(self, self.get_hookimpls(), kwargs)
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\pluggy\manager.py", line 68, in _hookexec
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     return self._inner_hookexec(hook, methods, kwargs)
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\pluggy\manager.py", line 62, in <lambda>
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     firstresult=hook.spec.opts.get("firstresult") if hook.spec else False,
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\pluggy\callers.py", line 208, in _multicall
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     return outcome.get_result()
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\pluggy\callers.py", line 80, in get_result
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     raise ex[1].with_traceback(ex[2])
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\pluggy\callers.py", line 187, in _multicall
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     res = hook_impl.function(*args)
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\xdist\dsession.py", line 81, in pytest_sessionstart
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     nodes = self.nodemanager.setup_nodes(putevent=self.queue.put)
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\xdist\workermanage.py", line 68, in setup_nodes
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     nodes.append(self.setup_node(spec, putevent))
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\xdist\workermanage.py", line 77, in setup_node
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     node.setup()
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\xdist\workermanage.py", line 244, in setup
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     basetemp = self.config._tmpdirhandler.getbasetemp()
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\_pytest\tmpdir.py", line 117, in getbasetemp
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     return py.path.local(self._tmppath_factory.getbasetemp().resolve())
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\_pytest\tmpdir.py", line 65, in getbasetemp
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     ensure_reset_dir(basetemp)
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\site-packages\_pytest\pathlib.py", line 41, in ensure_reset_dir
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     path.mkdir()
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\pathlib.py", line 1248, in mkdir
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     self._accessor.mkdir(self, mode)
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>   File "W:\Miniconda\envs\_dev_eden-win64-py36\lib\pathlib.py", line 387, in wrapped
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR>     return strfunc(str(pathobj), *args)
10:14:27 INTERNALERROR> FileExistsError: [WinError 183] Cannot create a file when that file already exists: 'W:\\workspace\\eden-master-win64\\tmp'
```

@RonnyPfannschmidt any hints?

https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-xdist/blob/a630e55887717b0c3fec078680ae861f78acf6fe/src/xdist/workermanage.py#L245-L248

wondering if its having a order issue for the init

Hmm not sure, because `setup_node` is called serially by `setup_nodes`, which in turn is called from here:

https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-xdist/blob/a630e55887717b0c3fec078680ae861f78acf6fe/src/xdist/dsession.py#L290

Which executes on `master`... ðŸ¤”
Happened again today... strange that we have not updated pytest recently.
I will take some time to investigate, there's something fishy going on.

Found out what the problem is.

By changing `ignore_errors=False` here:

https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/2180d9ef6d9af45c80fdc89cd64b90df2924c8a7/src/_pytest/pathlib.py#L39-L45

I now can see the actual error:

```
INTERNALERROR>   File "w:\ws\Souring\envs\eden-dev-py36\lib\site-packages\_pytest\pathlib.py", line 49, in rmtree
INTERNALERROR>     shutil.rmtree(str(path), ignore_errors=False)
INTERNALERROR>   File "w:\ws\Souring\envs\eden-dev-py36\lib\shutil.py", line 494, in rmtree
INTERNALERROR>     return _rmtree_unsafe(path, onerror)
INTERNALERROR>   File "w:\ws\Souring\envs\eden-dev-py36\lib\shutil.py", line 384, in _rmtree_unsafe
INTERNALERROR>     _rmtree_unsafe(fullname, onerror)
INTERNALERROR>   File "w:\ws\Souring\envs\eden-dev-py36\lib\shutil.py", line 384, in _rmtree_unsafe
INTERNALERROR>     _rmtree_unsafe(fullname, onerror)
INTERNALERROR>   File "w:\ws\Souring\envs\eden-dev-py36\lib\shutil.py", line 384, in _rmtree_unsafe
INTERNALERROR>     _rmtree_unsafe(fullname, onerror)
INTERNALERROR>   [Previous line repeated 4 more times]
INTERNALERROR>   File "w:\ws\Souring\envs\eden-dev-py36\lib\shutil.py", line 389, in _rmtree_unsafe
INTERNALERROR>     onerror(os.unlink, fullname, sys.exc_info())
INTERNALERROR>   File "w:\ws\Souring\envs\eden-dev-py36\lib\shutil.py", line 387, in _rmtree_unsafe
INTERNALERROR>     os.unlink(fullname)
INTERNALERROR> PermissionError: [WinError 5] Access is denied: 'w:\\ws\\Alfasim\\Projects\\eden\\tmp\\popen-gw5\\test_check_synced_with_remote0\\test_git_utils\\repo1\\.git\\objects\\62\\0cdeb1cfdfd9fb573569acefa573581db759e1'
```

Some of our tests create a dummy git repository to interact with it, and git marks some files inside the git repository as read-only.

I'm thinking of calling `chmod` to change all files under `path` to be read-write. Any other suggestions @RonnyPfannschmidt?
Pure python version of it please

I planned to open a PR tomorrow with a reproducer and some working solution for discussion, but here you go:

```python
import os
import stat

def test(tmpdir):
    fn = tmpdir / 'foo.txt'
    fn.write('hello')
    os.chmod(str(fn), stat.S_IREAD)
```

```
Î» pytest test-ro.py --basetemp=tmp -q
.
1 passed in 0.02 seconds

Î» pytest test-ro.py --basetemp=tmp -q
E
============================== ERRORS ===============================
______________________ ERROR at setup of test _______________________

self = WindowsPath('c:/pytest/.tmp/tmp'), mode = 511, parents = False
exist_ok = False

    def mkdir(self, mode=0o777, parents=False, exist_ok=False):
        """
        Create a new directory at this given path.
        """
        if self._closed:
            self._raise_closed()
        try:
>           self._accessor.mkdir(self, mode)

C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\pathlib.py:1246:
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

pathobj = WindowsPath('c:/pytest/.tmp/tmp'), args = (511,)

    @functools.wraps(strfunc)
    def wrapped(pathobj, *args):
>       return strfunc(str(pathobj), *args)
E       FileExistsError: [WinError 183] NÃ£o Ã© possÃ­vel criar um arquivo jÃ¡ existente: 'c:\\pytest\\.tmp\\tmp'

C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\pathlib.py:387: FileExistsError
====================== short test summary info ======================
ERROR test-ro.py::test - FileExistsError: [WinError 183] NÃ£o Ã© poss...
1 error in 0.11 seconds
```

(Note I'm calling pytest twice)

The main issue here is using `--basetemp`, because when that flag is used we will try to use the given directory directly instead of trying to create a numbered dir inside it. That's why I was having this error on just one project, as we don't usually pass `--basetemp` except for that one project.

issue.title: Fix rmtree to remove directories with read-only files

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing
